federal.title: Wages
federal.description:
The wages on the Job Bank website are specific to an occupation and provide information on the earnings of workers at the regional level. Wages for most occupations are also provided at the national and provincial level. In Canada, all jobs are associated with one specific occupational grouping which is determined by the National Occupational Classification. For most occupations, a minimum, median and maximum wage estimates are displayed. They are update annually.

If you have comments or ques

federal.title: Occupational injuries
federal.description:
The dataset shows claims for occupational injuries registered in one calendar year and admitted no later than March 1 of the following year. 

Occupational injuries are recorded in CNESST systems following the receipt of claims.

These claims represent workers who were covered by the occupational health and safety insurance plan for which the CNESST is responsible.

The _Law on Industrial Accidents and Occupational Diseases_ (LATMP) aims to compensate for occupational injuries and the cons

federal.title: Infrastructure Economic Accounts, economic impact by asset, industry, and asset function
federal.description: The economic contribution as a result of the production of infrastructure assets due to investment is presented for valued added (GDP), compensation of employees and number of jobs. Value-added is a key measure of economic performance. It represents the output of an industry minus the value of intermediate inputs that were used up in the production of the goods and services. Within the Infrastructure Economic Accounts, this is the value added due to an industry's production of infrastructure ass

federal.title: Historical minimum wage rates in Canada
federal.description:
The minimum wage is a basic labour standard that sets the lowest wage rate that an employer can pay to employees who are covered by the legislation. Today, one of its main purposes is to protect non-unionized workers in unskilled jobs, although it can also influence, directly or indirectly, the level of compensation of other employees as well. 
A minimum wage constitutes a floor above which employees or their unions may negotiate with management for higher remuneration. However, it is rarely st

federal.title: Employer Records
federal.description: The data is based information reported to Workers’ Compensation Board by March 31 for employers who are required to have WCB accounts. The dataset contain employer-specific information on occupational fatality, lost-time and disabling injury claims and presented as counts and rates. This information allows for the tracking of workplace health and safety performance indicators over time.

federal.title: Federal Jurisdiction Workplace Survey 2015
federal.description: The purpose of the Federal Jurisdiction Workplace Survey is to produce statistical information on the characteristics of workplaces under federal labour jurisdiction. The data is used by Employment and Social Development Canada for policy research and development.

federal.title: Federal Jurisdiction Workplace Survey 2004
federal.description: The purpose of the Federal Jurisdiction Workplace Survey is to produce statistical information on the characteristics of workplaces under federal labour jurisdiction. The data is used by Employment and Social Development Canada for policy research and development.

federal.title: The effectiveness of regulatory inspections in reducing work injuries in Alberta
federal.description: The Inspections Evaluation Analytical Dataset is an administrative dataset structured at the level of the employer-industry-year-month using a combination of data from employer and claim-level workers compensation data, and OHS regulatory enforcement activity. The underlying data were provided to the Partnership for Work, Health and Safety (PWHS) by the Alberta Workers Compensation Board (WCB) and the Government of Alberta for the purposes of conducting an evaluation of the effect of regulatory

federal.title: Non-reported work-related injuries among Licensed Practical Nurses
federal.description: The OHS Futures Research Funding Program provided a grant to the researcher. The researcher used the grant to study factors associated with Licensed Practical Nurses filing injury claims to the Worker’s Compensation Board of Alberta. This dataset provides some of the information collected during this study.

federal.title: Human resource management practices and work injury rates in Alberta small and medium-sized firms
federal.description: The dataset links data from two sources of information: (1) individuals with executive titles in a sample of small to medium- sized enterprises in Alberta were surveyed in 2016 and 2018 about their organization's human resource management practices, and (2) archival organizational-level injury data from Alberta Workers' Compensation Board from 2014 to 2019. Thus, the purpose of this dataset is to connect human resource management practices with injury data at the organizational level in a sample

federal.title: Canada Pension Plan (CPP) - Number of CPP recipients by benefit type and gender
federal.description: Data on the number of recipients of CPP Retirement, Disability and Survivor benefits by gender for the month of June from 1981 to 2025.

federal.title: Average monthly payments for new Canada Pension Plan (CPP) disability beneficiaries by age group, gender and calendar year ($)
federal.description: The Canada Pension Plan (CPP) disability benefit is a monthly payment made to eligible CPP contributors who are unable to work regularly at any job because of a severe and prolonged disability. This dataset provides information on the average monthly amount paid to new CPP disability beneficiaries during a calendar year, from 2010 to 2024. Data are disaggregated by age group and gender. Payments made under international agreements on social security are not included.

federal.title: Average monthly payments for new Canada Pension Plan (CPP) disability beneficiaries by province, gender and calendar year ($)
federal.description: The Canada Pension Plan (CPP) disability benefit is a monthly payment made to eligible CPP contributors who are unable to work regularly at any job because of a severe and prolonged disability. This dataset provides information on the average monthly amount paid to new CPP disability beneficiaries during a calendar year, from 2010 to 2024. Data are disaggregated by province and gender. Payments made under international agreements on social security are not included.

federal.title: Average monthly payments for Canada Pension Plan (CPP) disability beneficiaries by age group, gender and calendar year ($)
federal.description: The Canada Pension Plan (CPP) disability benefit is a monthly payment made to eligible CPP contributors who are unable to work regularly at any job because of a severe and prolonged disability. This dataset provides information on the average monthly amount paid to CPP disability beneficiaries during a calendar year, from 2010 to 2024. Data are disaggregated by age group and gender. Payments made under international agreements on social security are not included.

federal.title: Average monthly payments for Canada Pension Plan (CPP) disability beneficiaries by province, gender, and calendar year ($)
federal.description: The Canada Pension Plan (CPP) disability benefit is a monthly payment made to eligible CPP contributors who are unable to work regularly at any job because of a severe and prolonged disability. This dataset provides information on the average monthly amount paid to CPP disability beneficiaries during a calendar year, from 2010 to 2024. Data are disaggregated by province and gender. Payments made under international agreements on social security are not included.

federal.title: Monthly average number of Canada Pension Plan (CPP) disability benefits by province, gender, and calendar year
federal.description: The Canada Pension Plan (CPP) disability benefit is a monthly payment made to eligible CPP contributors who are unable to work regularly at any job because of a severe and prolonged disability. This dataset provides information on the monthly average number of recipients of CPP disability benefit during a calendar year, from 2010 to 2024. Data are disaggregated by province and gender. Benefits paid under international agreements on social security are not included.

federal.title: Net amount paid for Canada Pension Plan (CPP) disability benefits by province and calendar year ($'000)
federal.description: The Canada Pension Plan (CPP) disability benefit is a monthly payment made to eligible CPP contributors who are unable to work regularly at any job because of a severe and prolonged disability. This dataset provides information on the net amount paid to all CPP disability beneficiaries during a calendar year, from 1970 to 2023. Data are disaggregated by province. Payments made under international agreements on social security are not included.

federal.title: Canada Pension Plan (CPP) - Statistics on Monthly Maximum Amounts for New Benefits
federal.description:
Employment and Social Development Canada (ESDC) calculates Canada Pension Plan (CPP) monthly maximum benefit amounts for new beneficiaries. CPP monthly maximum new benefit amounts are for recipients starting to receive benefits in a particular month and year. Thereafter, most benefits are indexed annually according to the Consumer Price Index.

As of 2019, the CPP is being gradually enhanced every month. CPP benefits now include a base (representing the Plan, as it existed pre-2019) plus an en

federal.title: Canada Pension Plan (CPP) - Number of New Disability Benefits by Age, Gender and by Calendar Year
federal.description: Data on new recipients of CPP Disability benefits by gender, age group and the year when these new benefit recipients came into pay from 1993 to 2024.

federal.title: Canada Pension Plan (CPP) - Disability Benefits by Class of Diagnosis and Age Group
federal.description: Canada Pension Plan (CPP) Disability Benefits by Class of Diagnosis includes distribution of beneficiaries by age group updated on an annual basis. This annually updated table represents beneficiaries in pay as of December of each year. In order to ensure client confidentiality, an 'X' has been placed where the number of clients  receiving a particular benefit is equal to or below 9. In order to avoid residual disclosure, an 'X' has also been placed where the next number of clients was found, wh

federal.title: Regional unemployment rates used by the Employment Insurance program, three-month moving average, seasonally adjusted
federal.description: Regional unemployment rates used by the Employment Insurance program, by effective date, current month.

federal.title: Property and casualty companies
federal.description:
All publicly available financial data as filed by federally regulated property and casualty insurance companies are available free of charge from the Beyond 20/20 Web site.

Industry Totals: Please note that to determine total industry data, you must add “Total Canadian P&C”, “Total Foreign P&C” and “Total Canadian Mortgage Insurers”.
(Up to and including Q4 2017, “Total Canadian P&C Companies” industry total included Canadian mortgage insurers’ data.)
(Effective Q1 2018, to determine “Total

federal.title: Life insurance companies
federal.description:
All publicly available financial data as filed by federally regulated life insurance companies are available free of charge from the Beyond 20/20 Web site.

Industry Totals: Please note that to determine total industry data, you must add "Total Canadian Life Companies" and "Total Foreign Life Companies".

(For 2023 reporting year, insurers with a December fiscal year-end will begin filing the new IFRS 17 return versions effective Q1 2023 and insurers with an October fiscal year-end are requi

federal.title: Fraternal benefit societies
federal.description:
All publicly available financial data as filed by federally regulated fraternal benefit societies are available free of charge from the Beyond 20/20 Web site.

Industry Totals: Please note that to determine total industry data, you must add "Total Canadian Fraternal Benefit Societies" and "Total Foreign Fraternal Benefit Societies".


Third-Party Information Liability Disclaimer
For periods beginning in fiscal 2023 (January 2023 for calendar year-ends; November 2023 for October year-ends)

federal.title: Work-Sharing (WS) Program Statistics
federal.description:
The Work-Sharing (WS) Program is an adjustment program through Employment Insurance (EI) involving employers, employees and Service Canada. It is designed to help employers and employees avoid layoffs when there is a temporary reduction in the normal level of business activity that is beyond the control of the employer. 

Employment and Social Development Canada (ESDC) has compiled data on various metrics related to WS applications and agreements. We have also archived statistics related to th

federal.title: Employment insurance beneficiaries (regular benefits) by province, territory and occupation, monthly, seasonally adjusted
federal.description: Number of employment insurance beneficiaries receiving regular income benefits, by province, territory and National Occupational Classification (NOC), seasonally adjusted, last 5 months.

federal.title: Employment insurance beneficiaries (regular benefits) by province, territory and occupation, monthly, unadjusted for seasonality
federal.description: Number of employment insurance beneficiaries receiving regular income benefits, by province, territory and National Occupational Classification (NOC), last 5 months.

federal.title: Employment insurance beneficiaries (regular benefits) by census metropolitan category, monthly, seasonally adjusted
federal.description: Number of employment insurance beneficiaries receiving regular income benefits by census metropolitan category, last 5 months.

federal.title: Employment insurance beneficiaries by census metropolitan category, monthly, unadjusted for seasonality
federal.description: Number of employment insurance beneficiaries by census metropolitan category, total and regular income benefits, declared earnings, sex, and age group, last 5 months.

federal.title: Employment Insurance beneficiaries by employment insurance region, monthly, unadjusted for seasonality
federal.description: Number of employment insurance beneficiaries by employment insurance region, total and regular income benefits, declared earnings, sex, and age group, last 5 months.

federal.title: Ontario COVID-19 zones
federal.description: On November 3, 2020, Ontario released a COVID-19 Response Framework which categorized public health unit regions into five zones: * Green-Prevent * Yellow-Protect * Orange-Restrict * Red-Control * Grey-Lockdown For each zone, there were different public health and workplace safety measures for businesses and organizations. Data includes: * Public Health Unit (PHU) * PHU’s website * COVID-19 zone __We are no longer updating this data. It is best suited for historical research and analysis.__

federal.title: Ontario COVID-19 outbreaks data
federal.description: This dataset compiles daily snapshots of publicly reported data on 2019 Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreaks in Ontario. [Learn how the Government of Ontario is helping to keep Ontarians safe during the 2019 Novel Coronavirus outbreak]( https://covid-19.ontario.ca/) Data includes: * Summary of cases associated with outbreaks, by outbreak setting and date * Summary of ongoing outbreaks by outbreak setting * Summary of ongoing outbreaks by Public Health Unit (PHU) **As of June 16, all COVID-19 d

federal.title: Deaths accepted
federal.description:
The dataset shows __death claims__ accepted by the CNESST from January 1 to December 31.

The CNESST administers the occupational health and safety regime. The _Law on Industrial Accidents and Occupational Diseases_ (LATMP) aims to compensate for occupational injuries and the consequences they cause for beneficiaries. The death claims presented in the dataset meet the following criteria:
 
* They are the consequence of a work accident or an occupational disease within the meaning of the LATM

federal.title: Prevention and inspection interventions
federal.description:
The dataset contains __prevention and inspection intervention files__ created from January 1 to December 31. 

The Commission on Standards, Equity, Health and Safety at Work (CNESST) focuses on the management of prevention by employers and workers and on the establishment or construction site of a prevention program or action plan. To carry out its mission, the CNESST carries out interventions in workplaces.

The assignment of files to the inspector takes into account the organization's guid

federal.title: Recognized Employers Under the Supporting Ontario’s Safe Employers Program
federal.description: [Supporting Ontario’s Safe Employers](https://www.ontario.ca/page/supporting-ontarios-safe-employers-program) is a voluntary program that promotes health and safety in the workplace and helps reduce injuries and illness. The Ministry of Labour, Immigration, Training and Skills Development runs the program under the direction of the Chief Prevention Officer (CPO). Employers that are recognized by the program have successfully implemented an occupational health and safety management system and [me

federal.title: The Canadian Radiological Monitoring Network - Pilot Program for Radioactivity in Atmospheric Deposition
federal.description: Health Canada’s Canadian Radiological Monitoring Network (CRMN) is a national network that routinely collects environmental samples for radioactivity analysis. More information about the CRMN network can be found here: https://www.canada.ca/en/health-canada/services/environmental-workplace-health/environmental-contaminants/environmental-radiation/canadian-radiological-monitoring-network.html As part of the regular network, deposition samples are collected from all stations and analysed on an as-

federal.title: Occupational Health and Safety worker fatality and critical injury counts report
federal.description: The numbers reflect incidents that were reported to and tracked by the Ministry of Labour. They exclude death from natural causes, death of non- workers at a workplace, suicides, death as a result of a criminal act or traffic accident (unless the OHSA is also implicated) and death from occupational exposures that occurred in the past. Data from the Ministry of Labour reflects Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) and Employment Standards (ES) information at a point in time and/or for specific rep

federal.title: Coroner’s Inquest Recommendations and Responses
federal.description: The Coroners Act authorizes the Chief Coroner for Ontario to conduct public inquests before a jury of five (5) community members into deaths occurring at construction and mining sites, in correctional institutions, while in police custody, or involving police use of force. The Chief Coroner also has the authority to conduct discretionary inquests into deaths of public interest. Inquest juries may issue recommendations to parties that, when implemented, are intended to improve the health and safe

federal.title: Occupational Health and Safety inspections report
federal.description: The Ministry of Labour inspects workplaces to monitor compliance with occupational health and safety legislation and regulations. These are considered to be proactive field visits. The ministry focuses on workplaces and/or sectors of the economy that have a history of poor compliance or high levels of work-related injuries. Data from the Ministry of Labour reflects Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) and Employment Standards (ES) information at a point in time and/or for specific reporting purp

federal.title: Transgender inclusion at Global Affairs Canada: Maddie’s story
federal.description: At Global Affairs Canada, we celebrate diversity in all its forms. In this story, we highlight resilience, celebrate talent and address the issue of workplace transition for transgender people.

federal.title: Ministers’ offices expenses
federal.description:
The dataset of “Ministers’ offices expenses” contains an annual report of all expenses incurred by the office of a head of a department or a ministry of state for the Government of Canada and charged to the Consolidated Revenue Fund. This dataset does not include civilian termination benefits and statutory expenditures such as the Minister's salary and motor vehicle allowance, employer contributions to superannuation and certain benefit plans and other items as specified in these policies.

Th

federal.title: Who we regulate
federal.description:
We regulate and supervise more than 400 financial institutions. In this dataset you’ll find a list of these institutions, updated daily. 

We regulate and supervise more than 1200 private pension plans for employees working in federally regulated industries. Here you’ll find a list of these plans, updated daily, or see our list of pooled registered pension plans. We’ve excluded some pension plans from the list for privacy reasons.

federal.title: Veterans Affairs Canada Audit of Overpayments - February 2014
federal.description:
The purpose of this audit is to provide assurance that departmental activities with respect to the processing of overpayments are in compliance with policies, procedures, and regulations. The audit reviewed the overpayments of four programs: Disability Award, Disability Pension, War Veterans Allowance, and Earnings Loss.

An overpayment is any amount paid to a beneficiary to which there is no entitlement, or which exceeds entitlement and are "debts to the Crown". Veterans Affairs Canada is req

federal.title: Veterans Affairs Canada Evaluation of Disability Benefits - August 2015
federal.description:
The evaluation of the Disability Benefits program was conducted in accordance with the Veterans Affairs Canada (VAC) Multi-Year Risk-Based Evaluation Plan 2014–19. 

The objective of the Disability Benefits program is to compensate Veterans/members and other individuals in recognition of the effects of service-related disabilities, death or incarceration/evasion/escape. 

The Disability Benefits program consists of both the Disability Pension and the Disability Award. The Pension Act of 1919

federal.title: Veterans Affairs Canada Evaluation of Disability Pensions and Awards - August 2010
federal.description: The evaluation of Veterans Affairs Canada’s (VAC) Disability Pension and Disability Award Programs originated in the requirement to support the renewal of the Terms and Conditions of the Disability Award Program by March 2011. The Disability Award Program is part of the New Veterans Charter (NVC) suite of programs introduced in 2006 in order to meet the needs of a shifting client demographic. The NVC represents the most sweeping changes to Veterans’ benefits and services in the past 60 years.

federal.title: Veterans Affairs Canada Audit of Earnings Loss - May 2013
federal.description: The Earnings Loss benefit is one of the supports available through Veterans Affairs Canada’s Financial Benefits Program. Earnings Loss is payable in recognition of the economic impact a military career-ending or service-related disability may have on the Veteran’s ability to earn income following release from the Canadian Armed Forces. This income replacement ensures that the eligible Veteran's income does not fall below 75% of their gross pre-release military salary. The guaranteed minimum rate

federal.title: Veterans Affairs Canada Evaluation of the Veterans Affairs Canada (VAC)-Service Canada Partnership - December 2015
federal.description: In 2012, Veterans Affairs Canada (VAC) and Service Canada entered into a Partnership whereby Service Canada would use their web, in-person and telephone services to provide general information on VAC’s benefits and services to individuals who visit Service Canada’s website, visit a Service Canada Centre or call VAC’s toll-free line. In addition, Service Canada would accept and review applications for the Disability Benefits Program and the Veterans Independence Program (VIP). The intention of th

federal.title: Canada Pension Plan (CPP) - Number of Benefits, by Place of Residence and Benefit Type
federal.description: This dataset provides information on the number of benefits, by place of residence and benefit type for the Canada Pension Plan (CPP).  It is part of the Monthly Canada Pension Plan and Old Age Security Statistical Bulletin - a monthly publication that provides information on the number of benefits and new benefits by place of residence (province). In order to ensure client confidentiality, an 'X' has been placed where the number of clients  receiving a particular benefit is equal to or below 9.

federal.title: Canada Pension Plan (CPP) - Number of New Benefits, by Place of Residence and Benefit Type
federal.description: This dataset provides information on the number of new benefits, by place of residence and benefit type for the Canada Pension Plan (CPP). It is part of the Monthly Canada Pension Plan and Old Age Security Statistical Bulletin - a monthly publication that provides information on the number of benefits and new benefits by place of residence (province). In order to ensure client confidentiality, an 'X' has been placed where the number of clients receiving a particular benefit is equal to or below

federal.title: Veterans Affairs Canada Audit of Hearing Loss Decisions - December 2014
federal.description:
The Veterans Affairs Canada (VAC) Disability Benefits Program provides eligible Veterans and other qualified individuals with benefits under the Pension Act and the Canadian Forces Members and Veterans Re-establishment and Compensation Act. Hearing Loss is the most claimed service-related medical condition under each of these Acts.

In September 2014, in response to findings presented to the Minister regarding the number of Hearing Loss claims being approved in one region of Nova Scotia, the M

provincial.title: Ontario Disability Support Program (ODSP) disability adjudication data
provincial.description:
The Ministry of Community and Social Services data set for Ontario Disability
Support Program (ODSP) adjudication contains ODSP disability adjudication
applications and their outcomes (decisions, decision dates, type of
disability).

provincial.title: Disability Adjudication Database
provincial.description:
The Disability Adjudication Database (DAD) has incorporated integrated
workflows and file staging customized to the ministry's Disability
Adjudication Unit (DAU)'s business processes. It tracks what happens to a
referral for Ontario Disability Support Program (ODSP) benefits from the time
a disability determination package is received at the DAU. The database
follows the referral as it goes through the various stages of the adjudication
process, including appeals to the Divisional Court.

provincial.title: Developmental disability support: client profiles
provincial.description:
This dataset includes snapshot information for 33,615 individuals, including:

  * age
  * gender
  * living arrangement
  * income source(s)
  * communication
  * use of disability aids
  * health and medical conditions
  * behavioural traits
  * level of support need

The 2010 survey was completed by agencies providing residential services.

The 2013 survey was completed by agencies providing non-residential services.

Responses from multiple agencies for the same client were consolidated to
e

provincial.title: Ontario Disability Support Program cases and beneficiaries
provincial.description:
The Ministry of Community and Social Services reports the numbers of Ontario
Disability Support Program (ODSP) cases and beneficiaries (by family
structure), the number of children and Assistance for Children with Severe
Disabilities (ACSD) cases as of the end of month (April 2008 to present).

provincial.title: 2012 Canadian Survey on Disability data tables
provincial.description:
Variables include labour force status (employment, unemployment, unemployment
rates and participation rates), educational attainment, barriers to job
search, reasons difficult to change jobs, attendance at school, self-
employment, employer awareness of limitation, income, sources of income,
accommodations needed/obtained, workforce training, class of worker, major
field of study and employment by industry and occupation, by age group, Canada
and the provinces. Data is for 2010 to 2012, dependin
provincial.organization: Economic Development, Job Creation and Trade

provincial.title: Occupational Health and Safety rates
provincial.description:
Provides statistical information on workplace injury rates for traumatic
fatalities, occupational disease fatalities and critical injuries

provincial.title: Occupational Health and Safety worker fatality and critical injury counts report
provincial.description:
The numbers reflect incidents that were reported to and tracked by the
Ministry of Labour. They exclude death from natural causes, death of non-
workers at a workplace, suicides, death as a result of a criminal act or
traffic accident (unless the OHSA is also implicated) and death from
occupational exposures that occurred in the past.

Data from the Ministry of Labour reflects Occupational Health and Safety (OHS)
and Employment Standards (ES) information at a point in time and/or for
spe

provincial.title: Occupational Health and Safety inspections report
provincial.description:
The Ministry of Labour inspects workplaces to monitor compliance with
occupational health and safety legislation and regulations. These are
considered to be proactive field visits. The ministry focuses on workplaces
and/or sectors of the economy that have a history of poor compliance or high
levels of work-related injuries.

Data from the Ministry of Labour reflects Occupational Health and Safety (OHS)
and Employment Standards (ES) information at a point in time and/or for
specific repor

provincial.title: Recognized Employers Under the Supporting Ontario’s Safe Employers Program
provincial.description: [Supporting Ontario’s Safe Employers](https://www.ontario.ca/page/supporting-ontarios-safe-employers-program) is a voluntary program that promotes health and safety in the workplace and helps reduce injuries and illness. The Ministry of Labour, Immigration, Training and Skills Development runs the program under the direction of the Chief Prevention Officer (CPO).  Employers that are recognized by the program have successfully implemented an occupational health and safety management system and [m

provincial.title: Ministry of Labour, Training and Skills Development Prevention Office Research Grants
provincial.description:
Get data on grants, recipients and project information distributed by the Ministry of Labour, Training and Skills Development under a number of research programs.

This dataset details funding provided to recipients under the Bridging the Gap, Research Opportunities Program, Applied Research Questions, and the Occupational Health & Safety Prevention and Innovation programs.

These grants aim to improve occupational health and safety outcomes by supporting projects that reduce workplace injur

provincial.title: Canadian Survey on Disability (CSD) 2022
provincial.description:
Dataset excerpt from the Canadian Survey on Disability (CSD) provided by Statistics Canada. The data in this table have additional details compared to datasets available on the Statistics Canada website. All data provided is on an annual basis for reference year 2022.

Source: Statistics Canada, Canadian Survey on Disability (CSD), March 2025. Reproduced and distributed on an "as is" basis with the permission of Statistics Canada.

provincial.title: Student Headcount by Disabilities or Diverse Abilities Category
provincial.description:
Headcount of students by disabilities or diverse abilities (special needs) funding code:  
*Category A – Physically Dependent  
*Category B – Deafblind  
*Category C – Moderate to Profound Intellectual Disability  
*Category D – Physical Disability / Chronic Health Impairment   
*Category E – Visual Impairment  
*Category F – Deaf or Hard of Hearing  
*Category G – Autism Spectrum Disorder  
*Category H – Intensive Behaviour Intervention / Serious Mental Illness  
*Category K – Mild Intellectual

provincial.title: Annual Labour Force Characteristics and Wages by Disability Status from Labour Force Survey (LFS)
provincial.description:
Dataset excerpts from the Labour Force Survey (LFS) provided by Statistics Canada. The data in this table have additional details compared to datasets available on the Statistics Canada website. 

All data provided is on an annual basis and covers the period 2022 to 2023. 

Source: Statistics Canada, Labour Force Survey, October 2024. Reproduced and distributed on an "as is" basis with the permission of Statistics Canada.

provincial.title: BC Public Service - Workforce Profiles
provincial.description: The Workforce Profiles dataset provides important perspective on representation of equity groups within the B.C. Public Service and all of its ministries and organizations.

provincial.title: Budget 2012 - Supports To Individuals and Families Tbl 1.16
provincial.description: A tabular presentation of planned costs of direct support to British Columbia individuals and families for the years 2012-13, 2013-14 and 2014-15, includes values for income assistance, support for developmental disabilities and communications assistance

provincial.title: Alberta Aids to Daily Living program manual Section L : lifters, homecare beds and accessories benefits
provincial.description: The Alberta Aids to Daily Living (AADL) program manual includes information on eligibility, cost-share exemption, quantity and frequency review requests and vendor, authorizer and specialty supplier roles and responsibilities. The program manual also includes policies and procedures for each benefit area and approved product lists. The manual is broken into sections for easier reference.

provincial.title: Alberta Aids to Daily Living program manual Section X : seating and wheelchair accessory benefits
provincial.description: The Alberta Aids to Daily Living (AADL) program manual includes information on eligibility, cost-share exemption, quantity and frequency review requests and vendor, authorizer and specialty supplier roles and responsibilities. The program manual also includes policies and procedures for each benefit area and approved product lists. The manual is broken into sections for easier reference.

provincial.title: Assured Income for the Severely Handicapped (AISH)
provincial.description: Providing information about the Assured Income for the Severely Handicapped program.

provincial.title: The Alberta Aids to Daily Living (AADL) bulletin [151 to current]
provincial.description: Alberta Aids to Daily Living assists Albertans with a long-term disability, chronic illness or terminal illness, in maintaining independence in their community. AADL provides funding for basic medical equipment and supplies to meet clinically assessed needs. The AADL bulletin provides notices, updates and reminders to AADL providers, vendors, suppliers and other interested parties.

provincial.title: Responses to public fatality inquiry recommendations
provincial.description: This dataset serves as a public tracking system for responses to recommendations made by judges as a result of a public fatality inquiry. For each inquiry, the tracking system records the name of the deceased, the cause and manner of death, the recommendations made by the judge to prevent similar deaths, the persons and organizations who were asked to respond to the recommendations, and their responses, if any.

provincial.title: Workers' Compensation Regulation
provincial.description: This Regulation contains detailed provisions regarding application of the Workers' Compensation Act.

provincial.title: Health Statutes Amendment Act, 2025 (Unproclaimed Sections Only)
provincial.description: Contains unproclaimed amendments to: Access to Information; Alberta Evidence; Alberta Health; Alberta Health Care Insurance; Alberta Sovereignty within a United Canada; Animal Health; Auditor General; Child and Youth Advocate; Child, Youth and Family Enhancement; Conflicts of Interest; Continuing Care; COVID-19 Related Measures; Crown’s Right of Recovery; Election; Election Finances and Contributions Disclosure; Emergency Health Services; Environmental Protection and Enhancement; Family and Comm

provincial.title: Workers' Compensation Act
provincial.description: The Workers' Compensation Act creates the Workers' Compensation Board (WCB) as a corporation and grants it authority to administer a system of workplace injury insurance for the workers and employers of the province of Alberta. The organization compensates injured workers for lost income, health care and other costs associated with a work-related injury through an employer funded model.

provincial.title: Prevention initiative annual update
provincial.description: Keeping workplaces and workers healthy and safe is the ultimate goal of the Prevention Initiative for Alberta’s Occupational Health and Safety system. This annual update reviews actions taken during the previous fiscal year, and outlines the path the Prevention Initiative has set for the upcoming year.

provincial.title: Alberta wage and salary survey : average wages by industry and economic region
provincial.description: This bienneial survey provides information on wages and salaries for full- and part-time employees by occupation, region, and industry. The survey helps Albertans make career and education choices and helps organizations determine pay scales.

provincial.title: Worker fatally injured after fall through roof
provincial.description: Presents findings of an investigation of a workplace fatality that occurred in June 2023 in the construction and construction trades sector. A worker was replacing the metal roofing on the building when the worker fell through an opening and sustained fatal injuries.

provincial.title: Worker fatally injured when struck by a falling load
provincial.description: Presents findings of an investigation of a workplace fatality that occurred in July 2022 in the business and professional services sector. A worker was using a mobile crane during equipment maintenance activities when the load fell from the crane and struck the worker, resulting in fatal injuries.

provincial.title: Worker fatally injured after exposure to carbon monoxide
provincial.description: Presents the findings of an investigation of a workplace fatality in the business, personal and professional services sector that occurred in February, 2023. A worker was using a hooded supplied air respirator while sandblasting equipment. Carbon monoxide was released into the worker's air supply, resulting in a fatal exposure injury.

provincial.title: Workers’ handbook on occupational health and safety
provincial.description: This pocket-sized handbook is a quick health and safety reference for Alberta workers. It introduces some key health and safety concepts, along with examples of common workplace hazards, frequently used controls and quick tips that workers can use everyday.

provincial.title: Workers' Compensation Act
provincial.description: The Workers' Compensation Act creates the Workers' Compensation Board (WCB) as a corporation and grants it authority to administer a system of workplace injury insurance for the workers and employers of the province of Alberta. The organization compensates injured workers for lost income, health care and other costs associated with a work-related injury through an employer funded model.

provincial.title: Données de compensation de base GPS
provincial.description: Ces fichiers permettent aux utilisateurs d'ajouter des corrections à leurs données en post-traitement, améliorant ainsi leur précision.

provincial.title: Sondage - Expérimentation de mobilité autonome à Montréal
provincial.description:
Cet ensemble de données présente deux sondages effectués dans le cadre des projets pilotes de navettes autonomes ayant eu lieu sur le territoire de Montréal depuis 2018 portés par la Ville ou auxquels la Ville a collaboré. 

Le premier a été fait l'automne 2018 auprès des utilisateurs des navettes ayant opéré au Parc Olympique et passants sur le site. La [documentation](
https://parcolympique.qc.ca/nouvelles/2019/12/navette-electriques-autonomes-au-parc-olympique-publication-du-rapport-du-pro

provincial.title: Sondage du Défi des villes intelligentes
provincial.description:
Dans le cadre du Défi des villes intelligentes, la Ville de Montréal a sollicité la communauté pour définir les orientations de sa candidature. Afin d’imaginer le Montréal de demain, un sondage a été lancé afin d'entendre les citoyens sur les grands enjeux montréalais qui ont le plus d’impact sur leur qualité de vie.  Le présent ensemble présente les résultats de ce sondage.
Plus d'informations sur la candidature de Montréal sont disponibles sur la plate-forme [Réalisons-Montréal](https://www.r

provincial.title: Agriculture urbaine : sondage auprès de la population de l’île de Montréal
provincial.description:
La Division du développement durable de la Ville de Montréal a confié à la firme Bureau d’intervieweurs professionnels (BIP Recherche) la réalisation d’un sondage auprès de la population de l’Île de Montréal portant sur l’agriculture urbaine. Dans ce contexte, l’agriculture urbaine est entendue comme la production alimentaire en milieu urbain.

Le sondage visait à :  
  - Mesurer la proportion de Montréalais qui pratique l’agriculture urbaine ;  
  - Connaître, parmi les agriculteurs urbains

provincial.title: Sondage Rêvons Montréal 2020-2030
provincial.description: Consultation réalisée par la Ville de Montréal auprès de la population et de ses employés. Le sondage en ligne Rêvons Montréal 2020-2030 a obtenu 12 500 réponses, dont 4 000 de personnes à l'emploi de la Ville de Montréal. Pour en savoir plus sur le [plan stratégique Montréal 2030](https://montreal.ca/articles/montreal-2030-un-premier-plan-strategique).

provincial.title: Northern Fire Protection Program (NFPP)
provincial.description:
This database contains registrations/resignations, Fire Department Roster,
training records for each member, WSIB information, invoices paid through
Business Support/RMS or P-Card, NFPP equipment, invoices on individual truck,
record maintenance, annual tests and repairs.

  *[NFPP]: Northern Fire Protection Program
  *[WSIB]: Workplace Safety and Insurance Board

provincial.title: Detailed harmonized traumatic fatalities
provincial.description:
Provides information on the number of occupational traumatic fatalities which
are jointly compiled by the Ministry of Labour and the Ontario Workplace
Safety and Insurance Board (WSIB) since 2009

provincial.title: OMAFA workplace incident and accident reporting
provincial.description:
This dataset contains information collected by managers from employees within the Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Agribusiness (OMAFA) who experienced incidents or accidents in the workplace.  The collection of this data is required under the Occupational Health and Safety Act (Bill 168).  

The data collected is:

* used to conduct investigations of workplace violence, harassment, or threats of violence 
* shared with the Centre for Employee Health, Safety and Wellness to enable

provincial.title: Ontario Disability Support Program (ODSP) Employment Supports Management System
provincial.description:
The Ontario Disability Support Program (ODSP) Employment Supports Management
System (ESMS) uses portions of the Social Assistance Management System (SAMS)
dataset to facilitate employment supports management functions that are not
currently supported by the SAMS application. SAMS is a case management system
for social assistance clients.

provincial.title: Dental benefits for Ontario Disability Support Program (ODSP) clients
provincial.description:
The Ministry of Community and Social Services data set for the Ontario Dental
Association benefits contains information on Ontario Disability Support
Program (ODSP) clients in receipt of dental benefits. It includes:

  * claim number
  * procedure number
  * tooth code
  * service date
  * paid amount, etc.

provincial.title: Ontario Disability Support Program (ODSP) / Ontario Works field office satisfaction survey
provincial.description:
These survey results contain staff satisfaction information from field offices
regarding the Service Delivery Model Technology (SDMT) system. SDMT is the
provincial application system that, until October 2014, supported the delivery
of social assistance under the Ontario Disability Support Program (ODSP) and
Ontario Works programs.

provincial.title: Ontario Disability Support Program (ODSP) / Ontario Works field office business process survey
provincial.description:
These survey results track field office staff activities in the Service
Delivery Model Technology (SDMT) system, including: client inquiry,
preliminary assessment, client appointment, client interview and application,
eligibility determination, Disability Adjudication Unit (DAU) referral, grant
social assistance, participation requirements, financial processing, ongoing
case management, financial eligibility review, appeals, and ODSP employment
support.

SDMT is the system that, until October 20

provincial.title: Labour Market Agreement for Persons with Disabilities (LMAPD) Ontario Disability Support Program (ODSP) survey data (individual level)
provincial.description:
To improve the employment situation for Canadians with disabilities, the
Government of Canada provides funding through a Labour Market Agreement for
Persons with Disabilities (LMAPD) with the Government of Ontario.

The Ministry of Community and Social Services uses this yearly survey for
Ontario Disability Support Program (ODSP) clients for annual reporting to the
Government of Canada. The survey reports on a number of indicators about ODSP
income and employment supports.

provincial.title: Short Term Training Services (STTS) service provider survey data
provincial.description:
The Ministry of Community and Social Services evaluated the Short Term
Training Services (STTS) pilot with this one-time survey of Ontario Disability
Support Program (ODSP) employment support service providers who received
funding as part of the STTS pilot.

The purpose of the pilot was to provide ODSP employment supports clients with
access to labour-market oriented short-term training to improve clients'
overall employability and employment outcomes.

provincial.title: Ontario social assistance rates
provincial.description:
The Ministry of Community and Social Services compiles various Ontario
Works/Ontario Disability Support Program (ODSP) rates (basic needs, shelter,
etc.) and rates for federal and provincial income security and tax benefit
programs.

provincial.title: Social assistance operational indicators data set
provincial.description:
The Ministry of Community and Social Services reports monthly information on
operational indicators by Ontario Works Consolidated Municipal Service
Manager/District Social Services Administration Board (CMSM/DSSAB) and Ontario
Disability Support Program (ODSP) region/local office, in the following areas:

  * intake
  * case management workload
  * customer service
  * accountability
  * financial

provincial.title: Ontario Disability Support Program (ODSP) Employment Supports Management System
provincial.description:
The Ontario Disability Support Program (ODSP) Employment Supports Management
System (ESMS) uses portions of the Social Assistance Management System (SAMS)
dataset to facilitate employment supports management functions that are not
currently supported by the SAMS application. SAMS is a case management system
for social assistance clients.

provincial.description:

Association benefits contains information on Ontario Disability Support

  * claim number
  * procedure number
  * tooth code
  * service date
  * paid amount, etc.

provincial.title: Labour Market Agreement for Persons with Disabilities (LMAPD) Ontario Disability Support Program (ODSP) survey data (individual level)
provincial.description:
To improve the employment situation for Canadians with disabilities, the
Government of Canada provides funding through a Labour Market Agreement for
Persons with Disabilities (LMAPD) with the Government of Ontario.

The Ministry of Community and Social Services uses this yearly survey for
Ontario Disability Support Program (ODSP) clients for annual reporting to the
Government of Canada. The survey reports on a number of indicators about ODSP
income and employment supports.

provincial.description:
These survey results contain staff satisfaction information from field offices
regarding the Service Delivery Model Technology (SDMT) system. SDMT is the
provincial application system that, until October 2014, supported the delivery
of social assistance under the Ontario Disability Support Program (ODSP) and

provincial.description:

Delivery Model Technology (SDMT) system, including: client inquiry,

eligibility determination, Disability Adjudication Unit (DAU) referral, grant

case management, financial eligibility review, appeals, and ODSP employment

SDMT is the system that, until October 20

provincial.title: Labour Market Agreement for Persons with Disabilities (LMAPD) Developmental Services employment supports survey data (individual level)
provincial.description:
To improve the employment situation for Canadians with disabilities, the
Government of Canada provides funding through a Labour Market Agreement for
Persons with Disabilities (LMAPD) with the Government of Ontario.

The Ministry of Community and Social Services uses this yearly survey of
Developmental Services (DS) clients for annual reporting to the Government of
Canada. The survey reports on a number of indicators about DS employment
supports. This dataset contains data at the individual level

provincial.title: Occupational Health and Safety orders report
provincial.description:
When an inspector finds that health and safety legislation or regulations are
not being complied with, a written order is issued to comply with the
legislation/regulation within a certain time period.

Data from the Ministry of Labour reflects Occupational Health and Safety (OHS)
and Employment Standards (ES) are captured at a point in time and/or for
specific reporting purposes. As a result, the information above may not align
with other data sources.

provincial.title: Occupational Health and Safety events report
provincial.description:
This dataset provides total numbers of events that have been reported to the
Ministry of Labour. Events are categorized as work refusals, complaints,
incidents, illnesses, occurrences, disputes or work stoppages registered with
the ministry regarding health and safety issues.

Data from the Ministry of Labour reflects Occupational Health and Safety (OHS)
and Employment Standards (ES) information at a point in time and/or for
specific reporting purposes. As a result, the information above

provincial.title: Occupational health and safety email client inquiries
provincial.description: Get data on the total number of public email inquiries related to occupational health and safety matters sent to webohs@ontario.ca by fiscal year.

provincial.title: Reported Occupational Health and Safety Event information
provincial.description:
Provides health and safety events information including event date and event
type such as injuries/incidents, work refusals and complaints reported to the
ministry since 2012

provincial.title: Occupancy Monitoring Database (OCCM)
provincial.description: This database is used for tracking the supply of beds in operation in long-term care homes for monthly reporting. Beds in operation are tracked/maintained using data from various sources within the Ministry of Health (MOH) and Ministry of Long-Term Care (MLTC). Data is submitted to MOH by MLTC and partly from OH (Home and Community Care Support Services) formerly the LHINs on an ad-hoc basis.

provincial.title: Occupational health and safety field visits, workplaces visited, and orders issued
provincial.description:
A field visit occurs when a ministry inspector visits a workplace to assess
compliance with the Occupational Health and Safety Act (OHSA) and regulations.
A workplace is considered any land, premises, physical location or thing at,
upon, in or near which a worker work.  An inspector may visit the same
workplace multiple times.

During the field visit, the inspector can issue orders to different companies
("contraveners") at a workplace to achieve compliance with OHSA and
regulations. Ins

provincial.title: Local Health Integration Network (LHIN) quarterly risk reports collected under the Agencies and Appointments Directive
provincial.description:
This database of qualitative information includes quarterly risk assessments
from the LHINs and mitigation strategies. The data are stored across multiple
workbooks. Risk categories are:

  * strategic
  * accountability/governance
  * operational
  * workforce
  * information technology and infrastructure

The information provided is used for decision-making and includes information
about funding, human resources, budget pressures, etc.

  *[etc.]: et cetera
  *[LHINs]: Local Health Integration

provincial.title: Ambulance Dispatch Reporting System (ADRS) data
provincial.description:
This dataset provides details of all 911 calls received by the Ontario land
ambulance dispatch system (through 22 ambulance communication centres located
across Ontario). Dataset includes administrative and basic demographic data.
